intro: Hyptis erythrostachys, commonly known as red-stemmed hyptis, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and aromatic, releasing a pleasant scent when crushed. Hyptis erythrostachys is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
